skillTree.localised_description: Skullmuncha is Azhag’s wyvern - an incredibly vicious and temperamental beast that will only tolerate the Slaughterer on its back.
Azhag has no tolerance for infighting, when he issues an order the boyz must "get on wiv it" or pay with a particularly grisly death.
Tunnel bosses are Greenskins who are good at shoutin’ and hollerin’ at mobs when underground, where space and sight is an issue.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 during subterranean siege battles
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +10 during subterranean intercept battles
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Bellower’s voice is as deep as it loud, carrying across the battlefield, making sure the boyz are focused on the carnage.
You can’t trust ‘im. E’s a little bit woaah, a little bit Waaagh! Ya know? Well dodgy.
Held aloft and kept there by the rampant lunacy of their leader, Azhag's forces are all the stronger for his insane presence.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -25% for all Orc and Big ‘Uns infantry and cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

Passive ability: "Frenzy" for all Orc and Big ‘Uns infantry and cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Stoopid gits, I sed NOWWWWW!!!!!!!"

effects.description:
Melee defence: +8 for all Orc and Big ‘Uns infantry and cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for all Orc and Big ‘Uns infantry and cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +15% for Orc Arrer Boyz and Savage Orc Arrer Boyz units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Azhag's mysterious crown whispers fell plans and dastardly schemes; sometimes he understands them and passes the general gist to the Shamans in his army.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +4 for Shamans
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: There are some who whisper that the Slaughterer's wild schemes are not sufficiently Orcy. Needless to say, the crown normally lets him know so he can weed out the dissenters.

effects.description:
Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for all Orc and Big ‘Uns infantry and cavalry units
	(Lord's army)
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +24%

skillTree.localised_description: Enchanted armour and weapons, and the influence of the crown, allows Azhag to 'let go' somewhat on the battlefield!
When the crown takes control Azhag falls into a trance, his eyes cloud over and he mutters and even argues with himself…
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Orc choppas are crude and hefty blades usually swung with violent joy by their owner. A choppa in full swing can have a brutal, crunching impact on the poor fool on the receiving end.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.
Orcs may be stronger, but Goblins are smarter, nastier, and better-er.

skillTree.localised_description: Greenskin cavalry can be devastating if the myriad mounts can behave. Getting a big stick and maybe a "carrot" in the form of an orange-painted gobbo is the answer!

skillTree.localised_description: This Boss is one with "da boyz", egging the lads on to greater feats and to hit bigga stuff with their choppas.

skillTree.localised_description: Ridin’ on chariots means ya can be even more fighty, an' even more killy!

skillTree.localised_description: Even bigga than a Black Orc, an' not bad at killin’ too!

skillTree.localised_description: This Boss realises the power of "flyin’ fings” and so invests a few teef in making sure his war machines can fling fings really far and really high!

skillTree.localised_description: The sneakiest and stabbiest gobboes are just as dangerous as the largest, fiercest Orcs.

skillTree.localised_description: It’s one fing to be big, but quite anuva to be strong as well!

skillTree.localised_description: Nuffin' smashes harder than a rock fallin' from da sky, except mebbe da Bad Moon, if it were to fall.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
A wise Boss knows how to lure the enemy into places where they can be ambushed or trapped with mobs that skulk in the tunnels below.

effects.description: Evasion chance when using the Underway: +6%
Evasion chance when using the Underway: +16%
Evasion chance when using the Underway: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: Raiders are good at marauding through enemy settlements - sending their denizens fleeing as their properties are despoiled.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Ravagers are merciless - they will sack an enemy settlement, take everything and kill any that get in their way.
These iron-hard gits are particularly tough and gnarly Greenskins, who - even if wounded - will be up and ready to fight before too long.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for Lords
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Occasionally an Orc will come along who is more "kunning" than the rest. He quickly rises in ranks as his plans end in victory.
A Boss that has the loyalty of the mobs means he doesn’t have to worry so much about "da boring stuff" like tents and bedding, as they’ll fight for him no matter what.
Being green meanz ya really mean.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Wyverns is good fer one thing, eatin', smashin', smellin' and flyin'."

items.colour_text: The Crown of Sorcery was found in the ruins of Todtheim by Azhag the Slaughterer. Its malign influence has helped the Warboss carve a path of destruction throughout the Empire, for the Crown whispers advice and grants the wearer the power of Death Magic.

effects.description: Enables advanced Lore of Death magic

Public order: -50% penalty due to presence or lack of corruption
	(local province)

items.colour_text: By the grace of Gork (or Mork), Azhag’s magical armour is so ‘ard, it can even protect those around him.
Slagga’s crude twin blades don’t just enable Azhag to enthusiastically slash up anyone who gets close, but also motivate da boyz to follow suit.
